sentences.english: Prophetic intellects began to think of themodernization of country China.
sentences.chinese: 先知先觉的知识分子开始了乡土中国现代化的思考。

sentences.english: He was an early believer in central-bank independence, long before this was fashionable.
sentences.chinese: 他还先知先觉地认为中央银行应当保持独立。

sentences.english: One the other hand, he was way in advance.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，他也算是先知先觉。

sentences.english: Subscribe to news feeds about your competitors
sentences.chinese: 订阅竞争对手新闻消息，保持先知先觉。

sentences.english: The redefining of justice and injustice is a prophetic sign of the last days.
sentences.chinese: 正义与非正义的重新签订是先知先觉的最后几天。

sentences.english: The experiences of the prophets are the best reading materials for later generations.
sentences.chinese: 先知先觉们的经历正是后人最好的读本。

definition: predictable/sth one can predict without being a clairvoyant
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
trader or dealer (of stocks and shares etc)
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
